concept.title: eVar
concept.shortdesc: A Custom Conversion Insight Variable. Use eVars to measure cause and effect, such as which internal campaigns influence revenue, which banner ads ultimately result in a registration, or the number of times an internal search is used before making an order. (If you want to measure traffic or paths, Adobe recommends using a property.)

conbody.p: In the code, s.eVar is the correct spelling. eVars are persistent variables that hold their value for longer than one page. Common uses for s.eVars include:

ul.li: eVars remember their specific values by referencing the VisitorID cookie in the visitor's browser.
These variables can contain a limit of 255 characters per hit (or less if using multi-byte characters).
eVars are highly customizable and can have their behavior altered via conversion variables in Admin Tools.
eVar values are case insensitive. For example, if your first eVar is set to VALUE, then the next day it is defined as value, the term VALUE would appear with two instances.
eVars cannot contain multiple values within the same image request. In this situation, using a List Var is recommended.
